page.title: 13The Old Railway, Horsmonden
page.content: The railway ran from Hawkhurst to Paddock Wood, to connect with the main line from London to the coast. It operated from l892 to l962. The station is now the old Station Garage owned by Mr. W. Barge & Son who do vehicle maintenance work. In the garage yard you can see the old platform and signal box and part of the old railway line covered with rubbish. The old tunnel under the Maidstone Road is now blocked. Part of the cutting at the back of the school has been filled in and is a field for grazing sheep. There was a railway bridge over the Goudhurst Road which was too low for the buses so they dipped the road but that was not enough so the buses were specially made. Signs of the old permanent way across the Parish still exist but all lines & sleepers were removed years ago.
